intro: Cacalia radula, commonly known as the slender cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and ray flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Cacalia radula is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
